TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {18606=2014 Returned to form to take over the title of ace of the Beacons’ staff as a junior … Appeared in a team-high 20 games, while starting 17 contests … Paced UMass Boston with a 7-11 record, a 3.28 earned run average and her team-high 111 innings pitched … Finished the year with the sixth-lowest ERA for a single-season in program history … Threw 11 complete games in 17 starts … Struck out 56 batters, while allowing 41 free passes … Registered eight putouts, 27 assists and just one error for a .972 fielding percentage … Recorded five strikeouts or more in six outings …  Tied the program-record for career shutouts with her sixth career shutout (March 19 against Trinity College) … Allowed just six hits and one walk to earn her first victory of the year in a 1-0 win over Trinity College … Limited Suffolk to six hits and one unearned run over seven innings in a 3-1 Beacons’ victory on April 2 … Threw a career-high nine innings and allowed just two runs, one earned, while striking out a season-high seven batters in a 3-2 win over Curry College April 21 … Went eight innings, giving up four earned runs to pick up her only LEC win of the year April 22 against Southern Maine., 22855=PERSONAL/HIGH SCHOOL Graduated from Everett High School in 2011 where she was a member of the softball, ice hockey, and golf teams ... Named a Greater Boston League All-Star in 2009, 2010, and 2011 ... Named Harry Agganis All-Star in her senior year ... Received Madeline English Award in 2011 for being the top athlete at her high school ... Led the Greater Boston League in pitching as a freshman ... Recorded a combined 50 career wins and had five no-hitters ... Received four varsity letters with the softball team, five varsity letters with the hockey team, and three varsity letters with the golf team ... Led the softball team to four-straight MIAA Tournament appearances ... Received the Unsung Hero Award in 2009 and 2011 as a member of the hockey team ... Named an Independent League All-Star in 2011 for hockey ... Daughter of Maureen and Richard Zullo ... Has three sisters Nichole, Jenna, and Rachel ... Majoring in Early Childhood Education., 21313=2012 Emerged as one of the top starters in the Little East Conference and the top underclassmen pitcher in the conference … Enjoyed one of the best seasons for a pitcher in program history ... Finished tied for fourth in UMB history with 10 wins in a single season, third all-time with a 3.10 ERA and tied for the program-record with three shutouts in a season … Started 18 of the 22 games she appeared in … Pitched a team-high 128.2 innings, the sixth-highest total in UMB history for a single year … Tallied 17 complete-games-good for seventh most all-time … Finished with a 10-10 record, the sixth-most wins in the LEC … Ended the year fifth in the conference with a 3.10 earned run average … Recorded 80 strikeouts and just 37 walks … Ran off four straight wins in four starts between March 27 and April 3 … Earned a complete-game victory in her first collegiate start March 12 against Ripon College … Held St. Joe’s College to two runs, one earned in a seven-inning complete game win against March 15 … Dominated Little East Conference rival UMass Dartmouth in an 8-0 six-inning, two-hit shutout April 1 … Recorded a career-high 8 strikeouts and allowed just five hits against Gordon College in her second complete-game shutout on April 11 … Allowed one unearned run over 14 innings in back-to-back starts against Keene State and Curry College … Held Western Connecticut State to two runs on six hits May 3 in the Little East Conference Tournament.         , 20034=2013 Used a strong second half to put together another solid season as one of the Beacons starting pitchers … Ended the season with a 7-14 record in 21 starts … Totaled the seventh-most complete games in school history with 19 … Finished the season with the fourth-most innings in school history at 132.0 … Ended the year amongst the top-10 in the UMB record books with 72 strikeouts and a 3.87 earned run average … Took her first two collegiate trips to the plate and finished 0-for-2 … Picked up her fourth career shutout March 16 with a two-hit, five inning shutout win over Thomas College … Held Salve Regina University to two runs (one earned) over seven innings March 24 in a 4-2 win … Strung together three straight victories from April 9-16 in which she allowed five earned runs and struck out 12 over 20 innings … Earned a huge Little East Conference win April 24 by allowing two runs and striking out a season-high eight batters over eight innings in a 3-2 win over the University of Southern Maine … Shut down Salem State University for seven hits and no runs in her next start, a 4-0 win on April 25 … Allowed five runs, four earned, in a 5-1 loss to Eastern Connecticut State University in the Little East Conference Tournament.}
